info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 10:56AM CDT until April 9 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Cumberland River At Dover affecting Stewart County.
Red River At Port Royal affecting Robertson and Montgomery Counties.
For the Cumberland River...including Dover, Clarksville...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Red River...including Port Royal...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cumberland River at Dover.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 69.0 feet, Flood waters continue to cover many roads and boat launch areas across Stewart County. Impacted locations include Bellwood Landing Rd, Cross Creek Rd, Frank Earhart Rd near Mud Hill Rd, River Rd west of Hwy 79, Hummingbird Hollow Rd near Antioch Rd southwest of Bumpus Mills, Mud Hill Rd, Mallard Rd, Lewis Circle Rd, Lee Hollow Rd, Lakeland Dr, Atkinson Dr, and Wildcat Creek Rd east of Hwy 46. Ferry operations at Hwy 46 may be suspended at higher levels.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 67.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 68.1 feet this evening, then slowly fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 66.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
